greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = lcm(n,6) / gcd(n,6).
comment: If n == 2 or 4 (mod 6) then a(n) = 3*n/2; if n == 3 (mod 6) then a(n) = 2*n/3; if n == 1 or 5 (mod 6) then a(n) = 6*n; otherwise, a(n) = n/6. Examples: n = 50 = 6*8+2, a(50) = 3*50/2 = 75; n = 23 = 6*3+5, a(23) = 6*23 = 138. - _Bruno Berselli_, Mar 08 2017
link: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,0,2,0,0,0,0,0,-1).
results.author: _Colin Barker_, Mar 07 2017
